info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 6 at 4:52AM CDT by NWS Lubbock TX
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Lubbock TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas...
Double Mountain Fork Brazos near Lubbock 4ESE affecting Lubbock County.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued this afternoon at noon CDT.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Double Mountain Fork Brazos near Lubbock 4ESE.
* WHEN...From early this morning until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, flooding over FM-835 just west of Buffalo Springs requires closure of the highway. Flooding of loop road around the west end of Buffalo Springs Lake is also likely. The onset of flooding at FM-835 may be delayed by 4 to 6 hours after the river gauge at Southeast Loop 289 exceeds 11 feet or about 1000 CFS.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The stage fell from a peak of 11.92 feet last night to 10.2 feet as of 430 AM Friday. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
